results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of ‘journey making’ the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Pierre et Paul = Pierre and Paul
results.creator_credit: Rene Allio, Yves Robert and Leon Carre
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a middle manager in a building company, decides to buy a appartment and live with his girlfriend, Martine. But, the subsequent death of his father and various financial difficulties soon damage his mental equilibrium. When the May ‘68 riots errupt, Pierre goes off the rails.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre, Yves Robert ; director, Rene Allio ; writer, Rene Allio ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Jacques Dutronc.
Cast: Pierre Mondy, Robert Juillard, Bulle Ogier, Madeleine Barbulee, Helene Vincent.

results.title: Mwansa the Great
results.creator_credit: Rungano Nyoni, Gabriel Gauchet, ICreateFilms and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: A little boy sees himself as ‘Mwansa the great’, a full-grown warrior hunting lions. His little sister also visualises herself as an adult, ‘Princess Shula’ who is responsible for disciplining and looking after Mwansa.

results.title: Mapping a city of fragments v.2
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Using the opening of Godard’s film ‘Alphaville’ as a foundation, Lord constructs a vision of the evolving global city during the last years of the 20th Century. Structured as a series of repetitions, the montage of the changing city is offset by shots of Silicon Valley corporate facades. The result is a dialectical contrast between urban and suburban space, body and mind, chaos and order, and the post-modern and the modern. Shot in Hi-8 video in Tokyo, Fukuoka City, Mexico City, Rome, San Francisco, Naples and Los Angeles.

results.brief_description: A memory film set in Belfast in 1981 during the IRA hunger strikes which led to the death and eventual martyrdom of Bobby Sands. Quiet and powerful, ‘81’ contains multiple points of view, alternating between Catholic and Protestant, women and men, youth and adults. What lingers and what haunts are the vivid stark images of the prisoners’ gaunt faces on the television sets; the determined set of Thatcher’s jaw; Bobby Sands’ eyes staring out from the posters glued haphazardly on the Belfast streets.

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: Everything under the sun [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Italian.
